rev.comment: rv; non-free images in gallery/table of an infobox is not supported, per [[WP:NFG]]. More on your talk page.

|poptime = 768,100 (745,500 mixed, 22,600 un-mixed) in 1996<ref>http://books.google.co.uk/books?id=wgoFxfSTfYAC&pg=PA227&lpg=PA227&dq=the+australian+people+an+encyclopedia+of+the+nation+its+people+and+their+origins+Cornish&source=bl&ots=pQ8ZvHWpKe&sig=QwqYYxU2hVdQyxzv3GhPMdcOUPo&hl=en&ei=uKYMTfG_LJGYhQeC9_G3Dg&sa=X&oi=book_result&ct=result&resnum=4&ved=0CC4Q6AEwAw#v=onepage&q=table%203&f=false</ref><br />15,000 (reported ancestry, 1986 Census)<ref>Hale, Amy and Payton, Philip, New Directions in Celtic Studies, 2000</ref>
|poptime = 768,100 (745,500 mixed, 22,600 un-mixed) in 1996<ref>http://books.google.co.uk/books?id=wgoFxfSTfYAC&pg=PA227&lpg=PA227&dq=the+australian+people+an+encyclopedia+of+the+nation+its+people+and+their+origins+Cornish&source=bl&ots=pQ8ZvHWpKe&sig=QwqYYxU2hVdQyxzv3GhPMdcOUPo&hl=en&ei=uKYMTfG_LJGYhQeC9_G3Dg&sa=X&oi=book_result&ct=result&resnum=4&ved=0CC4Q6AEwAw#v=onepage&q=table%203&f=false</ref><br />15,000 (reported ancestry, 1986 Census)<ref>Hale, Amy and Payton, Philip, New Directions in Celtic Studies, 2000</ref>

Line 15: Line 15:
A 1996 study by Dr. Charles Price gives the total ethnic strength of Cornish Australians as 269,500. This is made up by 22,600 of un-mixed origin and 745,500 of mixed origin.<ref>http://books.google.co.uk/books?id=wgoFxfSTfYAC&pg=PA227&lpg=PA227&dq=the+australian+people+an+encyclopedia+of+the+nation+its+people+and+their+origins+Cornish&source=bl&ots=pQ8ZvHWpKe&sig=QwqYYxU2hVdQyxzv3GhPMdcOUPo&hl=en&ei=uKYMTfG_LJGYhQeC9_G3Dg&sa=X&oi=book_result&ct=result&resnum=4&ved=0CC4Q6AEwAw#v=onepage&q=table%203&f=false</ref> This makes the Cornish the fourth largest [[Anglo-Celtic Australian|Anglo-Celtic]] group in Australia after the [[English Australian|English]], [[Irish Australian|Irish]] and [[Scottish Australian|Scottish]].
A 1996 study by Dr. Charles Price gives the total ethnic strength of Cornish Australians as 269,500. This is made up by 22,600 of un-mixed origin and 745,500 of mixed origin.<ref>http://books.google.co.uk/books?id=wgoFxfSTfYAC&pg=PA227&lpg=PA227&dq=the+australian+people+an+encyclopedia+of+the+nation+its+people+and+their+origins+Cornish&source=bl&ots=pQ8ZvHWpKe&sig=QwqYYxU2hVdQyxzv3GhPMdcOUPo&hl=en&ei=uKYMTfG_LJGYhQeC9_G3Dg&sa=X&oi=book_result&ct=result&resnum=4&ved=0CC4Q6AEwAw#v=onepage&q=table%203&f=false</ref> This makes the Cornish the fourth largest [[Anglo-Celtic Australian|Anglo-Celtic]] group in Australia after the [[English Australian|English]], [[Irish Australian|Irish]] and [[Scottish Australian|Scottish]].
â
Approximately 10 percent of the population of [[South Australia]], and over 3 percent of Australia as a whole, has significant [[Cornish people|Cornish]] ancestry.<ref>http://www.busby.net/cawa/culture.html</ref> 15,000 people reported their ancestry as Cornish in the 1986 Australian Census.<ref>Hale, Amy and Payton, Philip, New Directions in Celtic Studies, 2000</ref> However, no figure from the 2006 Australian census has been published as to how many reported their ancestry as such in that year.
+
Approximately 10 percent of the population of [[South Australia]], and over 3 percent of Australia as a whole, has significant [[Cornish people|Cornish]] ancestry.<ref>http://www.busby.net/cawa/culture.html</ref> 15,000 people reported their ancestry as Cornish in the 1986 AustralianCensus.<ref>Hale, Amy and Payton, Philip, New Directions in Celtic Studies, 2000</ref>However, no figure from the 2006 Australian census has been published as to how many reported their ancestry as such in that year.
